As soon as I decided to help Akane,\nI started thinking of how to do it.%K%P
I asked Inori to talk to goddesses she knew, and got\nMaika to find out whatever she could on the net when\nshe had time.%K%P
They were both happy to help, things being\nwhat they were.%K%P
That left me - going to the library during the day\nand looking for clues on the net at night.%K%P
But none of this turned up anything useful,\nand we just burned up time.%K%P
'*Sigh* Huh...'%K%P
I sighed as I walked home from the library,\ntrying to shake off my thoughts.%K%P
It had been another day with very little\nprogress made.%K%P
'Hm, maybe this will give us a clue.'%K%P
In one book about goddesses I'd found, there was\nmention of 'spiritual balance.'%K%P
It seemed like maybe right now, Akane's\nspiritual balance was off, and it could be\ncausing her troubles.%K%P
'So then the problem is, what caused the unbalance?'%K%P
I felt it was unlikely to be her rehabilitation.%K%P
If that was the cause, then there should have\nbeen some similar case with all the other Aragami\nthat had been rehabilitated.%K%P
But since there was no mention of that anywhere,\nthere must be some other reason.%K%P
'For now, I'll just ask Maika\nand Inori what they think...\nHuh?'%K%P
'Hey, Sho!'%K%P
Akane came running toward me,\nwaving her hand.%K%P
'Akane? What's up?'%K%P
'Oh, nothing really. I just thought I'd come\nmeet you.'%K%P
'Meet me? How'd you find me?'%K%P
'I heard from Maika that you've been\ngoing to the library. I figured if I waited\nhere you'd come along.'%K%P
'Ah, yeah. Thanks for coming to meet me!'%K%P
'No big deal! I was bored anyway.\nAnd I always feel so comfortable with you.'%K%P
My heart lifted when she said that.%K%P
It made me happy to hear it so casually.%K%P
'Huh? What's with you?'%K%P
'N-Nothing.\nSo anyway, how's your Jinriki?\nFeel like it's coming back?'%K%P
'Nope. It's no good.\nIt's dead silent.'%K%P
Akane shrugged and laughed like she'd made a joke.%K%P
'Sorry. I've been looking and looking, but I haven't\nfound any clues on bringing it back.'%K%P
'Why are you apologizing? It's not your fault\nmy Jinriki's gone.'%K%P
'I mean, it looks like you've been working hard,\nI'm the one who should apologize.'%K%P
'Well, it's not done any good yet,\nso it's as good as nothing.\nI'll look more tomorr--'%K%P
'I don't mind if it doesn't come back.'%K%P
Akane interrupted me.%K%P
'What are you talking about, Akane?'%K%P
'I mean, if it never comes back, I don't have to\nworry about causing blackouts, right?'%K%P
'And then they won't tear down Tsubaki,\nand that's what you want, right?'%K%P
She was obviously putting a positive spin on it.%K%P
'Don't be ridiculous! Of course I want to save\nthe apartments. But that's no reason to\njust accept that your power is all gone!'%K%P
I couldn't accept Akane giving up like that.%K%P
At the same time, I was upset at myself for\nhow I was acting.%K%P
I wanted to help her, but my constant\nfailure was wearing at me.%K%P
'Are you really okay with not getting\nyour power back?'%K%P
'...Of course not. I want it back\nif it's possible at all.%K%P
'But if it does come back, then I might\ncause more blackouts and bother people.'%K%P
'And you're the one who'll suffer the most.'%K%P
'Are you okay with that?'%K%P
Oh, no. So that was what she was worried about.%K%P
'So you might cause blackouts. So what?\nIf you get your power back and\nare about to cause a blackout, I'll stop you.'%K%P
'I told you! No matter what happens,\nI'm by your side until the end!'%K%P
'That's right. You said you'd stick with me.'%K%P
'It's not like me to be so nervous.'%K%P
After she'd been trying so hard lately, it was nice\nto see a real smile on her face.%K%P
It was a relief to see her feeling better.%K%P
'Exactly. Just like when you were sick in bed.\nNow you're just worried about your Jinriki.'%K%P
'But just relax.'%K%P
I said it casually, on purpose, and Akane looked\ndown in thought.%K%P
'Well, let's get home before it gets late.\nMaika's probably getting worried.'%K%P
'Why are you...so nice to me, Sho?'%K%P
'Huh? Did you say something?'%K%P
'No, nothing. Never mind, let's just hurry!\nDinner's waiting!'%K%P
I took Akane by the hand and we walked back\nhome that way.%K%P
